original: de yang rigs pa ma yin no //

analyzed: sa zhag sngon po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The expression “a plant that has not yet become green” means a plant that has not yet taken on a green color.

original: ldam skya ba ni bum pa dang gos la sogs pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: ldam skya ba ni bum pa dang gos la sogs pa las byung ba'o //
translated: It means a plant that has not yet taken on a green color.🔽The expression “a half-formed embryo” means an embryo that has not yet taken on a human form.

original: 'di ni phyed skyes pa'i phyir yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni phyed skyes pa'i phyir yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood that this refers to an embryo that has not yet taken on a human form.

original: pha ba dgo dgo dang / sha mo la yang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: pha ba dgo dgo dang / sha mo la yang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The same should be understood with regard to a lump of flesh and a boil.

original: chu rtsa ni rtsva nya lcibs dang 'dra ba zhig ste /
analyzed: chu rtsa ni rtsva nya lcibs dang 'dra ba zhig ste /
translated: The expression “a plant that grows from water” means a plant that grows in water, like a lotus.

original: nya lcibs dang chu rtsa dag gi srog ni chu yin bas de bas na de dag phyung ba nyid ma rung bar byas pa yin pas de'i phyir ltung byed 'dir gsungs so //
analyzed: nya lcibs dang chu rtsa dag gi srog ni chu yin bas de bas na de dag phyung ba nyid ma rung bar byas pa yin pas de'i phyir ltung byed 'dir gsungs so //
translated: Since the life of oysters and water caltrops is water, they are ruined by removing the water. Therefore, this downfall is declared.

original: srog chags rnams ni bya ba gtogs pa rnams te /
analyzed: srog chags rnams ni bya ba gtogs pa rnams te /
translated: Creatures are those that are included among the actions.

original: de dag ming gis 'chang par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag ming gis 'chang par 'gyur ro //
translated: They are held by name.

original: gnas ni 'dug gnas so //🔽'byin pa ni drungs nas 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: gnas ni 'dug gnas so // 'byin pa ni drungs nas 'byin pa'o //
translated: A dwelling is a residence.🔽To remove is to dig out.

original: ma rung bar bgyid pa ni thams cad du 'joms @315a * //
analyzed: ma rung bar bgyid pa ni thams cad du 'joms @315a * //
translated: To ruin is to destroy completely.

original: pa'o // tshang ni gnas so //
analyzed: pa'o // tshang ni gnas so //
translated: A nest is a dwelling.

original: 'jug pa ni phyir glog pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa ni phyir glog pa'o //
translated: To enter is to return.

original: ma rung bar bgyid pa ni mes sreg pa'o //
analyzed: ma rung bar bgyid pa ni mes sreg pa'o //
translated: To ruin is to burn with fire.🔽If the eggs have not hatched, they should be destroyed.

original: sgo nga dag ma lhags na de'i tshe gzhig par bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i sgo nga med pa rnams gzhig par bcom ldan 'das kyis gnang ba ma yin na /
analyzed: sgo nga dag ma lhags na de'i tshe gzhig par bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i sgo nga med pa rnams gzhig par bcom ldan 'das kyis gnang ba ma yin na /
translated: If the Blessed One did not permit the destruction of eggs that are not yet hatched,

original: zhe na / 'di la 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: zhe na / 'di la 'gal ba med de /
translated: then there is no contradiction here.

original: 'di ltar dge 'dun gyi gnas dag la ni dge slong rnams la rang gi yin pa'i blo yod pas de nas tshang 'jig pa la bcos legs pa'i blo yod na rjes su gnang ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar dge 'dun gyi gnas dag la ni dge slong rnams la rang gi yin pa'i blo yod pas de nas tshang 'jig pa la bcos legs pa'i blo yod na rjes su gnang ngo //
translated: Thus, if the monks have the idea that the places of the Saṅgha are their own, then if they have the idea that it is good to repair them when they are destroyed, it is permitted.

original: gang la rang gi yin pa'i blo med pa de nas 'jig pa la 'di gzhag go //
analyzed: gang la rang gi yin pa'i blo med pa de nas 'jig pa la 'di gzhag go //
translated: But if they do not have the idea that they are their own, then it is not permitted.

original: pha ba dgo dgo ni 'brug grag pa'i tshe 'byung ba 'phrum 'dra pa'i rngad cig go //
analyzed: pha ba dgo dgo ni 'brug grag pa'i tshe 'byung ba 'phrum 'dra pa'i rngad cig go //
translated: A “thundering sound” is a sound like a thunderclap that occurs when a cloud thunders.

original: sha mo ni sha mo zhes bya ba'i rngad cig ste /
analyzed: sha mo ni sha mo zhes bya ba'i rngad cig ste /
translated: A “fungus” is a kind of grass called “fungus.”

original: sha mo kho lu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sha mo kho lu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is a synonym for “lichen.”

original: rnyis pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas nyes byas su gsungs pa ni shun pa mi rnyis pa 'chu na ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ltar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rnyis pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas nyes byas su gsungs pa ni shun pa mi rnyis pa 'chu na ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ltar shes par bya'o //
translated: The statement that it is a minor offense to “break off” and so on should be understood to mean that if one breaks off a piece of bark that is not dry, it is a fall.

original: 'di skad du yang shun pa snying po dang bcas te 'chu na ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di skad du yang shun pa snying po dang bcas te 'chu na ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is also stated that if one breaks off a piece of bark that has a pith, it is a fall.

original: me tog la sogs pa yang de dang 'dra bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: me tog la sogs pa yang de dang 'dra bar shes par bya'o //
translated: Flowers and so on should be understood in the same way.

original: bsnyen par ma rdzogs par zhes bya ba la sogs pas nyes byas su gsungs pa ni dge slob ma'i yul can du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bsnyen par ma rdzogs par zhes bya ba la sogs pas nyes byas su gsungs pa ni dge slob ma'i yul can du rig par bya'o //
translated: The statement that it is a minor offense if one is not fully ordained should be understood to refer to a probationary nun.

original: dge sbyong gi yul can ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi yul can ni ma yin te /
translated: It does not refer to a female novice.

original: de la rtsva gcod pa ni nyes pa rnam par gzhag pas so //
analyzed: de la rtsva gcod pa ni nyes pa rnam par gzhag pas so //
translated: The cutting of grass is not a fault for her.

original: dge slob ma la ni rnam par gzhag pas des ni de ltar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: dge slob ma la ni rnam par gzhag pas des ni de ltar shes par bya ste /
translated: A probationary nun should understand it in this way,

original: rtsva sngon gcad par mi bya'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsva sngon gcad par mi bya'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said that she should not cut green grass.

original: shing ni ljon pa'o //
analyzed: shing ni ljon pa'o //
translated: A tree is a large tree.

original: legs pa ni bzang ba'o //
analyzed: legs pa ni bzang ba'o //
translated: Good means excellent.

original: ma nyes pa ni nyen med pa'o //
analyzed: ma nyes pa ni nyen med pa'o //
translated: Not bad means not harmful.

original: nyes byas so zhes bya ba 'di ni 'dir lhangs por ma smras ba'i phyir shes par bya'o //
analyzed: nyes byas so zhes bya ba 'di ni 'dir lhangs por ma smras ba'i phyir shes par bya'o //
translated: Minor offense should be understood here as a general statement.

original: tshi gu ni rgya shug gi tshi gu'o //
analyzed: tshi gu ni rgya shug gi tshi gu'o //
translated: A berry is a jujube berry.

original: ma bcom par bya ba ni ma ldad par ro //
analyzed: ma bcom par bya ba ni ma ldad par ro //
translated: Not chewed means not chewed.

original: ril mid bgyid pa ni khyur mid du gtong ba'o //
analyzed: ril mid bgyid pa ni khyur mid du gtong ba'o //
translated: Swallowed means eaten.

original: nyes byas su zhes bya ba ni 'dir sbyor ba las byung ba'o //
analyzed: nyes byas su zhes bya ba ni 'dir sbyor ba las byung ba'o //
translated: Minor offense means here that it arises from application.

original: rung bar ma bgyis pa ni me la sogs pas so //
analyzed: rung bar ma bgyis pa ni me la sogs pas so //
translated: The seed is not fit to be eaten when it is burned by fire, etc.

original: sa bon du ma red pa ni gang dag gis tshi gu sa bon du ma red pa ste /
analyzed: sa bon du ma red pa ni gang dag gis tshi gu sa bon du ma red pa ste /
translated: The seed is not fit to be eaten when it is not a seed, such as a husk that is not a seed.

original: sa bon du ma gyur pa rnams zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sa bon du ma gyur pa rnams zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it is not a seed.

original: 'dis ni ji ltar me dang mtshon dang / sen mo dang / rnyis pa dang / ne tso dang / gnod pa dang / gshegs pa dang / bcad pa dang gzhig pa'i rung bar bya ba dang / de dag gis rung bar byas ba'i 'bras bu rnams bzar rung ba de bzhin du 'bras bu'i sa bon rdzogs so /
analyzed: 'dis ni ji ltar me dang mtshon dang / sen mo dang / rnyis pa dang / ne tso dang / gnod pa dang / gshegs pa dang / bcad pa dang gzhig pa'i rung bar bya ba dang / de dag gis rung bar byas ba'i 'bras bu rnams bzar rung ba de bzhin du 'bras bu'i sa bon rdzogs so /
translated: This shows that just as fire, weapons, fingernails, husks, parrots, harm, walking, cutting, and destroying make something fit to be eaten, and the fruits of what is made fit to be eaten are fit to be eaten, in the same way, the seed is completed by the fruit.
